Issues.Title: fix(bazel): ng_package(data) should support non-text files
Issues.Body:
Today non-text `ng_package(data)` files might (always?) get corrupted because they get read+written as utf8, for example font or image files.

I think the `utf8` will be used by default for non-binary files, so the param is not needed at all?

Issues.Body:
This PR removes unnecessary DOM reads (`classList` / `style`) in the most common case of using a procedural renderer. This simple change removes the most expensive function(s) (self time) from the profiller's radar.

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): ensure that ivy-specific code for ngStyle/ngClass is tree-shaken away properly
Issues.Body:
Prior to this fix all of the ivy code that lived inside of ngClass and
ngStyle would be loaded even when ivy was not present. This is because
the `defineDirective` code was being called on the top-level which means
that it is impossible to tree-shake it away. This patch fixes that
issue.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): ensure that ivy-specific code for ngStyle/ngClass is tree-shaken away properly" (#32732)

Issues.Title: Angular elements throws error when an element is consumed by root app and another element
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue may be caused by package @angular/core ### Description If i make an app1 with angular elements, and export this app1 to use those elements in another app it works just fine. The problem is when I want to make a second app2 with elements (to export more complex elements), which also uses elements from my app1 as external elements, and use both app1 and app2 as external elements in a third app3. If in my app3, i just use elements from app1, or just from app2 it works just fine. But when i use both it throws the following error: Error: Failed to execute 'define' on 'CustomElementRegistry': the name "blue-element" has already been used with this registry ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction I made this two based on [the article made by Tomas Trajan](https://medium.com/@tomastrajan/the-best-way-to-lazy-load-angular-elements-97a51a5c2007) first app exported: https://github.com/SantiagoIlli/simple-angular-element this one exports blue-element (a very simple angular element) second app exported: https://github.com/SantiagoIlli/complex-angular-element this one exports orange-with-blue-inside (is a simple angular element that use blue-element in it) You can see the error in this stackblitz: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-qwrhdz These are two repos to show how did I create the apps to export as external elements. Notice that if blue-element is used and orange-with blue is not used, works fine. If orange-with-blue is used and blue-element is not used, it also works fine. The problem is when i try to use both of them. ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: Importing .js file breaks dependancy injection
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package I cannot say for sure, but it might be @angular/compiler v. "~8.2.5". ### Is this a regression? No, I can see the same behaviour in Angular 7. But in Angular 5 I noticed something different - the DI container was not recognising the .js import as valid provider. ### Description Unexpected behaviour when a typescript file is imported with extension '.js'. The compiler does not complain, VS Code is happy with the import, DI does not error as in Angular 5 but instead treats the service as a new DI entry. The compiler should not allow importing not existing files or at least the '.js' extension should be ignored and therefore the DI container should work fine. I spent one hour debugging this, but if the compiler warned me that time could be used working on the actual app. To test this I created one service that is shared between components and provided it as a singleton by setting 'providedIn': 'root'. In one component I imported the service without extension (.ts is assumed) and in the other component I imported it with '.js' extension. Everything seems to work, no errors, but two instances of the service are created. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/Vallerious/test-ang-module ## üî• Exception or Error 



Nothing, but there should be

Issues.Title: fix(ngcc): support UMD global factory in comma lists
Issues.Body:
Previously we were looking for a global factory call that looks like:

```ts
(factory((global.ng = global.ng || {}, global.ng.common = {}), global.ng.core))"
```

but in some cases it looks like:

```ts
(global = global || self, factory((global.ng = global.ng || {}, global.ng.common = {}), global.ng.core))"
```

Note the `global = global || self` at the start of the statement.

This commit makes the test when finding the global factory
function call resilient to being in a comma list.

Issues.Title: extending/ reusing components html template
Issues.Body:
Hey there are some SO questions on that issue but nothing answers my question.

# üöÄ feature request

Let's say two components **C1** and **C2** are 90% identital in their class and **template**.

For components classes we can refactor the **Common code** into a base-class and then extend  **C1** and **C2**.

We don't have such a thing for HTML-templates.

It should work something like this:

**baseTemplate.html** (file)
```
<!-- common html goes in this file -->
```
and then

**C1.html** (file)
```
<span>I'm C1<\span>
ngCompilerIncludeHTML('path/baseTemplate.html')
<span>I'm still C1<\span>
```
and

**C2.html** (file)
```
<span>I'm now C2<\span>
ngCompilerIncludeHTML('path/baseTemplate.html')
<span>I'm still C2<\span>
```
### Description
I of course see a few problems.

+ How do we get lintable type/ error/ checking/ suggestions in **baseTemplate.html** while developing in our IDE.
+ How do we get lintable type/ error/ checking/ suggestions in **C1** and **C2** while developing in our IDE.
We would need some sort of parsed HTML preview.

Something like for **C1**:
```
<span>I'm C1<\span>
ngCompilerIncludeHTML('path/baseTemplate.html') {
   <!-- common html goes in this file -->
}
<span>I'm still C1<\span>
```
Not sure how we can live manipulate our **C1.html** file when **baseTemplate.html** changes.
Not sure if that's even possible.

Any suggestions?

### How do the best of best deal with this situation ?
**ng-template** can only be reused inside one single component as far as I know.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "extending/ reusing components html template" (#32714)

Issues.Title: docs(router): make `InitialNavigation` part of the public API
Issues.Body:
`InitialNavigation` is used in `ExtraOptions`, which is already part of the public API. Thus, `InitialNavigation` should be too. Not publicly exporting it from `router/index.ts` seems an omission, since the type is already annotated with the `@publicApi` JSDoc tag.

By publicly exporting `InitialNavigation`, it will also correctly appear in the API docs on angular.io.

Issues.Title: Unable to resolve @angular/core module when there is a symlinked package
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [x] serve - [x] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [x] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? No ### Description In case we have an application with symlinked typescript package (a typescript project that is required locally from another folder), `ERROR in Could not resolve module @angular/core` error is thrown. This happens when the symlinked package is added as first element in files property in `tsconfig.app.json` file [as shown here in demo app](https://github.com/Fatme/testApp/blob/2132f14ee2222a2d8d79fbf3b0513d18f04cf06c/tsconfig.app.json#L8). It seems that `@angular/core` module is required in source code [here](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/ec4381dd401f03bded652665b047b6b90f2b425f/packages/compiler-cli/src/transformers/program.ts#L562) in order to resolve all decorated elements from source file. It seems that `@angular/core` is searched for as a dependency relatively to the [first included source file](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/3166cffd28e12d882bef3e55472e0a50f4cfc6f5/packages/compiler-cli/src/transformers/compiler_host.ts#L192). Source files are gettered based on `tsconfig.json` file and mainly on `files`, `include` and `exclude` properties. However, in our particular case when there is a symlinked package, it matters if `@angular/core` will be searched for relatively to the symlinked package or relatively to the application as `@angular/core` is dependency in the application but it is not dependency of the symlinked package. The comment [here](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/3166cffd28e12d882bef3e55472e0a50f4cfc6f5/packages/compiler-cli/src/transformers/compiler_host.ts#L191) says that any containing file gives the same result for absolute imports. As we can see, there are situations when the order of the imported files affects the final result: * when file outside of the application is first element in files property in `tsconfig.app.json` file -> it is not possible to resolve `@angular/core` * when file from application is first element in files property in `tsconfig.app.json` file -> `@angular/core` is resolved correctly It seems that getting the first source file as containing folder is not the correct decision, maybe all files should be checked until `@angular/core` is found. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. git clone https://github.com/Fatme/symlinkedPlugin 2. git clone https://github.com/Fatme/testApp 3. cd symlinkedPlugin 4. `npm i` 5. cd ../testApp 6. `npm i` 7. `ng serve` > NOTE: If you change the order of files [here](https://github.com/Fatme/testApp/blob/master/tsconfig.app.json#L8) and `main.ts` is the first file, the issue will not reproduce. ## üî• Exception or Error 

ERROR in Could not resolve module @angular/core

### [`v0.29.0`](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/releases/0.29.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/compare/0.28.0...0.29.0)

### BREAKING CHANGES

`ts_library` strict dependencies now apply to libraries from npm.
You can use `deps=["@​npm//:node_modules"]` to depend on all node_modules, but this has performance implications.
We suggest adding missing dependencies individually to the `deps` of the `ts_library`, following guidance from the compile errors.

### Changes

New `check_bazel_version_range` function to ensure your team uses the Bazel version you require

We automatically generate a named UMD bundle at `@npm//node_modules/package:package.umd.js` so that the concatjs bundler can work with third-party libraries.

`ts_library` now automatically gathers typings from npm packages in the `deps`.

`web_package`

-   Support the same root paths as `ts_devserver`, fix for [#​728](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/728)

`rollup_bundle`

-   now includes the json plugin
-   bugfix for downleveling

##### Code Refactoring

##### Performance Improvements

Issues.Title: Ng lint produces to multiple xml content in single file
Issues.Body:
# üêû Ng lint produces to Multiple XML content in single file

### 
```
- [ x] new
- [x ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [x ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Is this a regression? Yes

Angular 5 Was not having this issue. Once we moved to Angular 7 we are facing this issue.
### Description
when we use ng lint for checkstyle it produces multiple xml content. This result in parsing failure of the xml.



## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
when i run this 
ng lint --format checkstyle > result-checkstyle.xml;

the result file contains : 
```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><checkstyle version="4.3"><file name="../shoppingcart-ang7/shoppingcart/src/app/app.component.ts"><error line="208" column="160" severity="error" message="trailing whitespace" source="failure.tslint.no-trailing-whitespace" /></file></checkstyle>
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><checkstyle version="4.3"></checkstyle>

```

This result in xml parsing error.

Issues.Title: Separate/Fork Schematics from Angular
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
- [x] none
```

### Description
Hi there!

I've been using Angular for years and have been an Angular fan since the beginning! Sadly, my company switched to React (sigh...)

Having been in ng-conf, I learned about Nrwl and their nx tool. Because of it, we are starting to use React for FE and have a Nest application as well. All of it generated by the Nrwl nx tool. Nrwl uses schematics under the hood to upgrade the React app as well as the Nest app, in the same way `ng update` does it for Angular. If I take a look at the `node_modules`, of course `@angular` is there. So, even if I use React and Nest, I'm using `@angular` under the hood ü§î...

So, my question is... Have you folks think about separating/forking schematics from Angular and make it its own beast?

Schematics is an awesome tool that in reality has nothing to do with the Angular framework. The whole community could benefit from it regardless of whether they use Angular.

React, Vue, Angular, Ember, Svelte, Nest, Express... you name it... They all could be using it if the use TS! Maybe even another languages other than TS could be using it by providing their own tree parser???... the sky is the limit!

### Describe the solution you'd like
In my opinion, Schematics is bigger than Angular and deserves recognition by itself! It could be simply named Google Schematics! Just another awesome open source project made by Google.

Opinions??

Thanks folks!!! Already missing Angular üò¢

Issues.Title: With Ivy, HTML Changes and BrowserModule not recognized immediately during ng serve
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [X] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: .... ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... When I create N Angular 8 app with Ivy enabled, I noticed that changes in HTML is no reflected immediately when I make changes to HTML during `ng serve`. It did finish recompile. With `ng serve` running, I added a newly added component in angular.component.html, I got this error: ``` ERROR Error: Template error: Can't bind to 'ngSwitch' since it isn't a known property of 'div'. at createUnknownPropertyError (core.js:12759) at validateAgainstUnknownProperties (core.js:12698) at elementPropertyInternal (core.js:12603) at Module.…µ…µproperty (core.js:19773) at AppComponent_Template (app.component.html:421) at executeTemplate (core.js:12177) at checkView (core.js:13615) at componentRefresh (core.js:13359) at refreshChildComponents (core.js:11858) at refreshDescendantViews (core.js:11757) ``` I stopped and re-ran `ng serve`. The above error didn't happen again. Then, I added *ngIf in an my component html file, specifically the auto generated `p` element, I got the following error. ``` core.js:6014 ERROR Error: Template error: Can't bind to 'ngIf' since it isn't a known property of 'p'. at createUnknownPropertyError (core.js:12759) at elementPropertyInternal (core.js:12625) at Module.…µ…µproperty (core.js:19773) at TestComponent_Template (test.component.html:3) at executeTemplate (core.js:12177) at checkView (core.js:13615) at componentRefresh (core.js:13359) at refreshChildComponents (core.js:11858) at refreshDescendantViews (core.js:11757) at checkView (core.js:13616) ``` However, these error went away after I stopped and re-ran `ng serve` so it wasn't because there was no BrowserModule. It didn't happen when I didn't have Ivy enabled. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Minimal reproduction repo: https://github.com/Jun711/angular8IvyApp You can also follow the following steps to reproduce 1) ng new angularApp --routing=false --enable-ivy --style=scss 2) cd angularApp 3) ng g c ./components/angular 4) ng serve --open 5) add `` in app.component.html You would see `Template error: Can't bind to 'ngSwitch' since it isn't a known property of 'div'.` and angular component is not added to app.component.html 6) add `*ngIf="count > 0"` in auto generated p element in angular.component.html `

angular works!

` You would see `Template error: Can't bind to 'ngIf' since it isn't a known property of 'p'.` 7) stop and re-run `ng serve` and these errors go away ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [webpack](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack) | devDependencies | minor | [`4.39.3` -> `4.40.2`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/webpack/4.39.3/4.40.2) |
| [webpack](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack) | dependencies | minor | [`4.39.3` -> `4.40.2`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/webpack/4.39.3/4.40.2) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>webpack/webpack</summary>

### [`v4.40.2`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v4.40.2)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v4.40.1...v4.40.2)

### Bugfixes

-   fix a bug where asset is undefined

### [`v4.40.1`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v4.40.1)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v4.40.0...v4.40.1)

### Bugfixes

-   convert "multiple assets emit to the same filename" error into a warning
-   compare asset content when multiple assets emit to the same filename

### [`v4.40.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v4.40.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v4.39.3...v4.40.0)

### Features

-   adds asset info for emitted assets
    -   new methods allow easy emitting/updating of assets `compilation.emitAsset/updateAsset` (instead of accessing the Object `compilation.assets`)
    -   new getter methods to get assets `compilation.getAssets()` and `compilation.getAsset(name)`
    -   3 flags in asset info:
        -   `immutable`: when set an asset can be cache infinitely
        -   `development`: when set an asset is some kind of development tool (i. e. a SourceMap)
        -   `hotModuleReplacement`: when set an asset is generated for an hot update
    -   Stats expose `info` object in assets
    -   String version of Stats show flags

</details>

Issues.Title: Allow globally configurable Mat Paginator Defaults
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Similar to how MatAutocomplete has MAT_AUTOCOMPLETE_DEFAULT_OPTIONS, I'd love to see MatPaginator have default options for often globally-identical inputs such as `pageSizeOptions`,  `pageSize`, and `showFirstLastButtons`.

#### Use Case

Many enterprise applications are composed of large collections of paginated list views. For consistency, these lists often have identical defaults for pageSizeOptions and pageSize. Having to configure each list view with a global constant (which has to be re-declared in the component to get access to it on the template) is annoying and prone to errors.

MatAutocomplete has solved this issue with the MAT_AUTOCOMPLETE_DEFAULT_OPTIONS injection token, allowing us to globally configure the `autoActiveFirstOption` property.

This is a feature request for something similar to that, but for MatPaginator.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Allow globally configurable Mat Paginator Defaults" (#17123)

Issues.Title: embedding mat-optgroup elements using *ngFor causes app to crash/freeze
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-xwukxn?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.html

Steps to reproduce:
1. Embedding `mat-optgroup` elements using *ngFor over a *hard-coded* array works OK.
```html
<mat-select>
  <mat-optgroup *ngFor="let g of [{name: 'group 1'}, {name: 'group 2'}]" [label]="g.name">
    <mat-option>None</mat-option>
  </mat-optgroup>
</mat-select>
```
2. However, trying to pass an array returned by an object getter to the *ngFor results in the app freezing.
```ts
class MyClass {
    get values() { return [{name: 'group 1'}, {name: 'group 2'}]; }
}

class MyComponent {
    instance = new MyClass();
}
```
```html
<mat-select>
  <mat-optgroup *ngFor="let g of instance.values" [label]="g.name">
    <mat-option>None</mat-option>
  </mat-optgroup>
</mat-select>
```
 
#### Expected Behavior

The `mat-select` should be displayed correctly.


#### Actual Behavior

The app freezes.


#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.0
- CDK/Material: 8.1.2
- Browser(s): Google Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "embedding mat-optgroup elements using *ngFor causes app to crash/freeze" (#17106)

Issues.Title: Dragging/sorting item in the nested cdkDropList always goes to the outermost cdkDropList.
Issues.Body:
<!--------

The Angular team can't provide general troubleshooting help. However, the extended community of
users can provide more help: 

StackOverflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/angular-material2
Gitter: https://gitter.im/angular/material2
Google Groups: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/angular-material2

Issues should capture only bug reports and feature requests. However, we understand that 
it is not always clear whether an issue is caused by a bug or incorrect usage of a feature/component.

Most support requests will be automatically closed. If the answer is quickly obvious, though, we 
might be able to provide a brief answer.

-------->


#### What are you trying to do?

Dragging or sorting inside/outside the nested droplist. 
Allow items in the nested droplist sorting inside/outside itself, even drag into the nested droplist of nested droplist and vice versa.
P/S: All droplists are linked to each other.

The current behaviour is that when to start dragging a nested list item, it will instantly get and move to the outmost container/droplist instead of within the nested droplist. It takes the outermost container because of the cursor is also located in it and according to **_getSiblingContainerFromPosition** function, it will take the first sibling container (which is outermost container) and ignore the inner containers.
Also, the function only considers getting the siblings and ignores the current container itself causing that we cannot do any sorting in the nested container and always move to the first outermost container.

#### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?

I tried to modify the  **_getSiblingContainerFromPosition** which is not recommended solution.
I do not know is there any way to achieve it but it works perfectly after I modify the function.
**_updateActiveDropContainer** should call **_getContainerFromPosition** which includes current container itself and also sibling containers, and resort it ascending order by the number of the droplist contains (find function will get the innermost container first instead of the outermost container).

Please advise. Thank you so much :)

#### Reproduction

We can only help if we can reproduce the problem ourselves. 

https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-dmuqfv?embed=1&file=app/zoo/zoo.component.ts

Steps to reproduce:
1. Items can be drag into another droplist.
2. Only items under the outer container can do the sorting.
3. When doing sorting for nested droplist items, it will move to the outer container.

P/S: Please ignore other buggy things since this sample code is to demonstrate for the mentioned issue only.
  
#### Environment

- Angular: 8
- CDK/Material: Drag and Drop
- Browser(s): Google Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows Server 2016
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Dragging/sorting item in the nested cdkDropList always goes to the outermost cdkDropList." (#17094)

Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-pr4ncb

Steps to reproduce:
1. Add a `mat-progress-bar` element in *buffer* mode
2. Change the element's height to a value different than the default 4px

There should be a single line of moving dots, centered in the progress bar height.

Issues.Title: Tooltip does not hide while scrolling.
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use CodeSandbox to reproduce your issue: https://vizi1.csb.app

This can also test in the material component view itself - [Material Component](https://material.angular.io/components/tooltip/overview)

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open this link - Sample Link
2. Hover the button
3. Tooltip will show
4. Scroll the page using Scroll Button in the Mouse
5. The tooltip will also scroll without hiding
6. In some time, it will hide in Chrome, but not in Microsoft Edge, sometimes Chrome too.

#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?

The tooltip should be hidden once the cursor leaves the target button when the user scrolls with the mouse scroll button without moving the cursor position.

#### Actual Behavior

The tooltip also scrolls with the button and stays back in the same position for some more time. In IE mostly the tooltip did not hide.

What behavior did you actually see?

I scroll the webpage using the mouse scroll button without moving the mouse position. The tooltip of the button scrolls up with the button without hiding as the mouse pointer already left the button.

#### Environment

- Angular: v8
- CDK/Material: v8.1.4
- Browser(s): Google Chrome Version 76.0.3809.132 , Microsoft Edge 42.17134.1.0
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows

```
<mat-tab-group [selectedIndex]="selected.value"
               (selectedIndexChange)="selected.setValue($event)">
  <mat-tab *ngFor="let tab of tabs; let index = index" [label]="tab">
    Contents for {{tab}} tab

    <button mat-raised-button
            class="example-delete-tab-button"
            [disabled]="tabs.length === 1"
            (click)="removeTab(index)">
      Delete Tab
    </button>
  </mat-tab>
</mat-tab-group>
```

Component Code is-
```
import {Component} from '@angular/core';
import {FormControl} from '@angular/forms';

/**
 * @title Tab group with dynamically changing tabs
 */
@Component({
  selector: 'tab-group-dynamic-example',
  templateUrl: 'tab-group-dynamic-example.html',
  styleUrls: ['tab-group-dynamic-example.css'],
})
export class TabGroupDynamicExample {
  tabs = ['First', 'Second', 'Third'];
  selected = new FormControl(0);

  addTab(selectAfterAdding: boolean) {
    this.tabs.push('New');

    if (selectAfterAdding) {
      this.selected.setValue(this.tabs.length - 1);
    }
  }

  removeTab(index: number) {
    this.tabs.splice(index, 1);
  }
}
```


Package.json is
```
{
  "name": "WFXERPAg",
  "version": "0.0.0",
  "scripts": {
    "ng": "ng",

Issues.Title: mat-checkbox makes mat-grid-tile non-resposive
Issues.Body:
Steps to reproduce:
create a mat-grid-list with tiles containing a mat-checkbox. See:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-y54cqq?embed=1&file=app/grid-list-overview-example.html
 
I expected the checkboxes to remain in the center of the tile while resizing the window e.g. by dragging the separator in stackblitz

Instead the checkboxes remained on their initial position. It appears that the figure which is created inside the tile no long responds the size changes of the tile. I used chrome developer tools to monitor the width and height of the tile and the figure. The tile size changes on resize, the figure size remains at its initial value.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-checkbox makes mat-grid-tile non-resposive" (#17095)
